abstract:
We show several results concerning finding approximate Nash equilibria in $k
\times k$ bimatrix games via payoff queries. For approximate Nash equilibria,
we give a randomized algorithm for finding a $(\frac{3 - \sqrt{5}}{2} +
\epsilon)$-Nash equilibrium using $O(\frac{k \cdot \log k}{\epsilon^2})$ payoff
queries. For well-supported Nash equilibria (WSNE), we first give a randomized
algorithm for finding an $\epsilon$-WSNE of a zero-sum bimatrix game using
$O(\frac{k \cdot \log k}{\epsilon^4})$ payoff queries, and we then use this to
obtain a randomized algorithm for finding a $(\frac{2}{3} + \epsilon)$-WSNE in
a general bimatrix game using $O(\frac{k \cdot \log k}{\epsilon^4})$ payoff
queries. We also show two lower bounds for finding well-supported Nash
equilibria in bimatrix games. We show that finding an $\epsilon$-WSNE requires
$k - 1$ payoff queries for any $\epsilon < 1$, even in win-lose games. Then we
show that finding a $\frac{1}{3k}$-WNSE requires $\Omega(k^2)$ payoff queries,
even in win-lose constant-sum games.
